intro: Lavoisiera harleyi, commonly known as the Harley's lavoisiera, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, humid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
